page.title: 02The Railway Embankment.
page.content:
The extreme south west corner of the segment is crossed by a disused railway embankment. The railway used to run from Hull to Barnsley and passed through many small villages and towns. The railway was closed in the !960's. The segment also touches the corner of Hessle Golf Club. The north end of the Humber Bridge was built on part of the original course and the new one was opened here at Raywell, six miles away, in 1975.
The land to the north of the golf course is arable farming land.
